p: Peganum harmala plays an important role in local ecosystem restoration as a drought-resistant species and is considered among the most important medicinal plants in North Africa. It is a rich source of Î²-carboline alkaloids (e.g., harmine, harmaline, harmalol and harman) and quinazoline alkaloids (e.g., vasicine and vasicinone) [ 5]. Steroids, anthraquinones, flavonoids, polysaccharides and amino acids are also found in its seeds, flowers, leaves, stems and roots [ 6].
